description: Tohru Honda is 16 year old orphaned girl who gets invited to live in the house of her classmate, the handsome boy Sohma Yuki, and his cousins, 16 year old Kyo and 27 year old Shigure. However, these young men and parts of the rest of their family (both close and distant) hold a curse; if they are hugged by the opposite gender, they transform into animals of the Chinese Zodiac. Everyday is an adventure for sweet Tohru, as she gets to know everyone in the large family better (especially Yuki and Kyo), in both common and bizarre situations. But, the Sohma Family curse is certainly no laughing matter... it also holds horrible cruelty and heartbreak.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Badminton
tags.description: Centers around the sport of badminton.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

title.native: フルーツバスケット 1st Season

node.description:
Laura Dawn Bailey is an American actress and voice actress. Best known for her anime roles (at first, Funimation titles but she has definitely moved on), she has also supplied voices in video games and worked as staff on several anime series. She's become one of the most prolific female voice actors in the AAA gaming industry since 2010.

Some of her best known anime roles are Lust in Fullmetal Alchemist, Young Trunks in Dragon Ball Z, Maka Albarn in Soul Eater, Tohru Honda in Fruits Basket, Sana Kurata in Kodocha, and Shin Nohara in the English dub of Crayon Shin-chan.

She is married to fellow voice actor [Travis Willingham](https://anilist.co/staff/95026/Travis-Willingham), and they have one son, Ronin.

Bailey primarily does video game voice overs and western animation nowadays, rarely getting any new anime roles, generally only reprising roles when she does anime. If she does get a new anime role, it's usually with Studiopolis.

Featured on "Critical Role."

[Website](http://www.laurabaileyvo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LauraBaileyVO)

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnburgmeier)__

He is the son of [Linda Young](https://anilist.co/staff/95252).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_takaya77)

Natsuki Takaya is a Japanese manga artist best known for creating the series Fruits Basket.

Takaya was born and raised in Tokyo, where she made her debut as a manga artist in 1992. Takaya is left handed and had wanted to be a manga artist since first grade, when her sister started drawing.

__Awards:__
* 2001: Kodansha Manga Award, Shojo : _Fruits Basket_
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/安部純)

__[Website](http://goto.cute.or.jp)__

Gotou began his career as an animator at Atorie. After the closing of Atorie, he worked for other studios such as Project Team Muu and Fenx before going freelancer. He serves as character designer, animation director and animator on countless anime series and contributes to a monthly comic strip to Newtype magazine.

He has been an animator since he graduated from high school at 18. Unlike most other animators Gotou had never gone to an art school. He became interested in animation after seeing an advertisement in an animation magazine saying that animators were needed. Without having any connections within the industry he went on and joined Atelier Giga and studied there for a year under [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/) before marking his debut as animator on [Mister Ajikko](https://anilist.co/anime/3437/).

In 1988 Studio Atelier declared bancrupcy and he went to Project Team Muu, which later became Phoenix Entertainment. His first work there was as animator on Anime Sanjushi. When working on the Yuusha Saga, he met Ishida Atsuko on Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn, who influenced Gotou in his character design, particularly the design of the eyes. Together with the experience from training under Yamashita Akihiko this influence resulted in Gotou's so called "gocky picture" later.

He made his debut as character designer on Choujin Densetsu Urotsukidouji 4 and his debut as series director on Kiddy Grade.

Married to [Megumi Kadonosono](https://anilist.co/staff/100963/).

(Source: Anidb)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/長濱博史) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Nagahama)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/長濱博史) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Nagahama)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

He is a Tokyo Polytechnic University graduate. Although Daichi was an aspiring stage photographer he instead joined animation photography company Tokyo Animation Film where he continued to work for 5 years, although he temporarily changed jobs and shot live-action karaoke videos instead. In 1991 he left his employer, worked at a game production for half a year, and returned to the animation industry where he would study under animation director [Tetsuo Yasumi](https://anilist.co/staff/111207/). Daichi would advance into episode direction and caught the eyes of [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/) and [Hiroaki Sakurai](https://anilist.co/staff/101153/) who were impressed with his work on [*Akazukin Chacha*](https://anilist.co/anime/103/Akazukin-Chacha). Daichi made his solo directorial debut in 1995 with [*Nurse Angel Ririka SOS*](https://anilist.co/anime/616/Nurse-Angel-Ririka-SOS). Since 2015 he serves as scriptwriter and director for [*Kodomo no Omocha*](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/Kodomo-no-Omocha/)'s stage version of which he directed the anime as well. Presently he's a freelance director.

**Style**
He specializes in high-tension comedy and often includes comedy and lighthearted moments even in more serious works. In his comedies he often smoothly deforms the characters far beyond their design, inspired by gag manga king [Fujio Akatsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/97141/). His directing work tends to include live-action images or brief flashbacks from past episodes. Since childhood Daichi became affected and inspired by the works of famous jidaigeki actor *Joushirou Konoe* inspiring him to make more historical samurai works.

Daichi is particular about choosing voice actors and has discovered several talents such as [Ayaka Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/95222/), [Nozomi Sasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/95580/), and [Reiko Yasuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/95373/). 

**Accolades**
- [*Ojarumaru*](https://anilist.co/anime/4459/Ojarumaru) won the 1999 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Maksete Iruka!*](https://anilist.co/anime/2791/Makasete-Iruka/) won the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Gyagu Manga Biyori*](https://anilist.co/anime/1196/Gyagu-Manga-Biyori) was recommended by the Japan Media Arts Festival Animation committee in 2005.

**Controversies**
In 2018 and 2019 voice actress [Hiroko Konishi](https://anilist.co/staff/96545/Hiroko-Konishi) alleged that she was propositioned by her manager to enter a mixed bath with Daichi in the nude and was blacklisted from the voice acting industry when she refused.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/156204341) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hiramatz/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tadashi-hiramatz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@hiramatz1963)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/156204341) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hiramatz/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tadashi-hiramatz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@hiramatz1963)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).

As is the case with many Japanese artists, her privacy was well guarded; little is known about her life apart from her artistic career. 

During the 90s, she continued singing and also wrote for anime voice actors. From 2000, she became involved in earnest with anime and composed several songs for Wedding Peach, Fruits Basket and Love Hina. She formed the duo Melocure in 2002 with singer-songwriter Megumi Hinata, and in the following two years, the duo released several singles and an album, Melodic Hard Cure. Okazaki also produced songs during these years for artists such as Megumi Hayashibara, Mayumi Iizuka, and Yui Horie.  Her work consists mainly of ballads, and can be categorised within the spectrum of Japanese music as most closely related to J-Pop. According to her fans, the lyrics of Okazaki's songs are characterized by poetic imagery, depth of emotion, gentle optimism and simplicity.  

On May 5, 2004, Ritsuko Okazaki died suddenly at the age of 44 from septic shock as a result of septicemia. She was unable to speak any last words, and left her work unfinished.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasunoriebina)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tuka_trg)

After graduating from the Department of Art at Osaka University of Arts he joined Studio Ghibli as photographer and later transferred to Gainax, where he made his debut as director on some episodes of Evangelion.
    
He left Gainax in 2011 to found [Studio Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/Trigger) together with [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi) and [Kazuya Masumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/150019/Kazuya-Masumoto). He is currently the CEO of the company.
[Website](http://hitoikizaka.com) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/武藤星児)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.
Married to [Masashi Sogo](https://anilist.co/staff/107529/).
Barry Watson is president and CEO of Illumitoon Entertainment. He was formerly a producer and voice director for FUNimation Entertainment.
